xxl.core.functions
Class Swapper<P,R>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.DecoratorFunction<P,R>
      xxl.core.functions.Swapper<P,R>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the function's parameters.
R - the return type of the function.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function<P,R>, Decorator<Function<? super P,? extends R>>
public class Swapper<P,R>
extends DecoratorFunction<P,R>

A Swapper decorates (wraps) a Function and swaps arguments when calling invoke(argument0, argument1) if demanded by the user or a given predicate.

Field Summary
protected  Predicate<? super P> swapPredicate
          The predicate determining if a swap is performed.

Method Detail

invoke

public R invoke(boolean doSwap,
                P argument0,
                P argument1)
This method provides enhanced functionality to this function by given the possibility of overruling the predicate controlling the swaps. If parameter doSwap==true the given arguments will be swapped otherwise not.

Parameters:
doSwap - overrules the internally stored predicate.
argument0 - the first argument to pass to the wrapped function.
argument1 - the second argument to pass to the wrapped function.
Returns:
the returned object of the wrapped function.

invoke

public R invoke(P argument0,
                P argument1)
This method invokes the wrapped function with the given arguments. The ordering of the arguments passed to the wrapped function is controlled by the given predicate. The predicate will be called in the given order of the arguments: 
   swapPredicate.invoke(argument0, argument1)

Specified by:
invoke in interface Function<P,R>
Overrides:
invoke in class DecoratorFunction<P,R>
Parameters:
argument0 - the first argument to pass to the wrapped function.
argument1 - the second argument to pass to the wrapped function.
Returns:
the returned object of the wrapped function.
